alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 9:10AM CDT until May 07 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Arkansas River at Ozark Lock and Dam affecting Logan, Franklin and Johnson Counties. ...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Kiamichi River near Antlers affecting Pushmataha County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kiamichi River near Antlers. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. Campers near the river should move to higher ground. At 25.0 feet, minor flooding begins along the west bank of the Kiamichi River near Moyers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall through this evening before rising again. The river is then expected to rise to a crest of 24.7 feet early Friday morning. Interests along the river should continue to closely monitor later forecasts. - Action stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
